title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com presents a local news quiz to engage readers on trending stories in Greater Boston.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019, contributes his expertise to the quiz content.
The quiz encourages readers to test their knowledge and stay updated on Greater Boston news.

title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to cut 20% of its workforce as part of a merger with the Viator brand.
The company aims to save $85 million by 2027 through restructuring and integrating more AI into services.
The layoffs will impact around 600 employees globally, as Tripadvisor realigns for experience-driven growth.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An abandoned tent was reported at a White Mountains camp site in New Hampshire on October 26.
Search and rescue found car keys and an Apple AirTag at the site but no matched vehicle in nearby parking.
Despite speculation and social media posts, no missing persons reports were filed and the tent remains unclaimed.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader, passed away on November 1, 2025, after a battle with ovarian cancer.
She founded CharityTeams in 2008, helping raise $42 million for nonprofits through athletic events, centered around the Boston Marathon.
A Celebration of Life will be held on November 8 at Waters Church Norwood, followed by a reception at Gillette Stadium.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket launched its own beer, a 'More For Your Dollar' lager, in collaboration with Zero Gravity Beer.
The 12-pack lager costs $12.99 and is sold at select MB Spirits and MB Beer & Wine locations in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire.
Market Basket's beer launch follows the recent ousting of CEO Arthur T. Demoulas, amid a period of company transition.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Over 900 defendants in Massachusetts remain without representation following a public defender work stoppage that began in May.
The SJC is considering whether judges can grant temporary pay raises to resolve the work stoppage amidst separation of power concerns.
In August, Massachusetts lawmakers approved a $20 hourly pay increase for bar advocates, yet over 900 defendants remain unrepresented.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston for a private dinner and book signing event.
She signed copies of her debut novel, 'Gone Before Goodbye,' which she co-authored with Harlan Coben.
Witherspoon was in Boston for a discussion at Harvard Business School and reflected on her film 'Legally Blonde'.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, Gov. Healey aide, arrested for cocaine trafficking in Springfield; Republicans question her hiring practices.
GOP demands Gov. Healey disclose vetting details, citing Cook's past criminal allegations during his 2023 hiring.
Republican gubernatorial candidates call for independent investigation into Healey's vetting process after Cook's arrest.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, died after a car crash in New Bedford on Route 140.
The crash occurred around 2 a.m. Saturday; Massachusetts State Police found the car off-road with significant damage.
A GoFundMe for Siqueira's funeral expenses raised nearly $26,000, surpassing its $20,000 goal before donations were halted.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police seek help identifying a man involved in commercial burglaries starting August 21 in downtown Boston.
The suspect reportedly used a pry tool to access businesses, stealing credit cards, cash, and electronics.
Photos of the suspect have been released; information can be reported to Boston police at 617-343-4571.
